text:
Great question!  My role started w focusing on content distro, copywriting, social, and creating/repurposing our content across the funnel. Now — I lead all of our social and other brand/TOFU activities (podcast, video, etc) and content distro/repurposing. 

Would love to hear from others on this, too.

text: Hey Redante! These coaches may not be an exact match for what you’re looking for as far as job titles (more UX focused, but also content design) but wanted to share the link just in case. They do portfolio reviews, interview coaching and many have switched fields as well. Worth looking into! <https://uxcontent.com/choose-your-coach/>

attachments.fallback: UX Content Collective: Choose Your Coach • UX Content Collective
attachments.text: Book a session with a UX coach for support with interviews, transitioning careers, building your portfolio, or starting a new role.
attachments.title: Choose Your Coach • UX Content Collective

These coaches may not be an exact match for what you’re looking for as far as job titles (more UX focused, but also content design) but wanted to share the link just in case. text: Many thanks! I will look them up

elements.text: Many thanks! I will look them up

text:
Jane is spot on - the definition changes depending on the company. Now that I'm back in-house, I'm in charge of content marketing strategy and that covers creating the content calendar across all our channels (blog, social, PR, demand gen, etc) and verticals. That includes determining the key themes and SEO targets per audience to act as the foundation for the calendar. Once that's set (though it is a living/dynamic calendar), I focus on performance and working with marketing ops to determine how to optimize content performance.

When I was a consultant creating a content strategy was different per client. For example, a start-up might just want to focus on their blog and newsletter first, so I'd build out themes and basic calendar, plus create some of the content. A large enterprise customer facing very specific issues requested I talk across the siloed marketing group to determine what was needed from content for a new program, determine the best channels and formats for a content marketing program, and then create theming and 3 episodic programs.

Once that's set (though it is a living/dynamic calendar), I focus on performance and working with marketing ops to determine how to optimize content performance.

When I was a consultant creating a content strategy was different per client.
